meanings.definition: A type of seabird found in Bermuda.
meanings.sent1: The cahow soared gracefully over the ocean.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a cahow nesting on the rocky cliffs.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cahow bring a suitcase to the beach?
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like the call of a cahow.
meanings.sent5: The colorful feathers of the cahow shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh cry.
meanings.sent1: The owl cahowed in the night, startling us awake.
meanings.sent2: The injured bird cahowed for help in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The cahowing seagull interrupted the peaceful morning.
meanings.sent4: His angry voice cahowed across the room, demanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm cahowed angrily, shaking the windows.
